title: The Importance of institution in the education of Studs Lonigan in Farrell's Young Lonigan
abstract: This thesis deals with Farrell's Young Lonigan will analyze Younq Loniqan, the first volume of a trilogy only since it exposes the education which is related to the development of the main character Moreover , it is going to find out the causes which make Studs ' indoor environments , family and school, as the institutions fail not carry out their desired function. Besides , it will find and do out the reasons why his outdoor become an important institution in his life . environments, streets, Therefore , in order to solve the problems of the with certa in literary devices such as setting thesis , this thesis deals and character- ization. In this thesis, setting will merely be used as a means of environment division the analysis , and is going find out why his indoor environments fail and his outdoor environment is important in his life . This w ill be seen through Studs' character. Finally , this thesis will prove that Studs' fam ily and school as the institutions fa il since he is d issatisfied and gets bored living in those p laces, and he considers the streets important in b is life . ln add ition , th is thesis will also ha ve a motivation to prevent a family, a school and other institutions from doing someth ing which can cause the failure of the education .
contributors: Liliek Soelistyo (Advisor 1); Prof. Dra. Ester Harijanti Kuntjara, MA., Ph.D. (Examination Committee 1)
source: Undergraduate Thesis No. 349; Shirley Luciawati L. (11491020)
subjects: AMERICAN FICTION-20TH CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING; FARRELL, JAMES THOMAS, 1904-1979. YOUNG LONIGAN-STUDY AND TEACHING
